website_summaries.verdict: Very inexpensive flashlight with solar panels built into it and that allow recharging with sun or a hand crank.
pros: Good for emergency situations, as it doesn't rely on a battery to power the LED
Uses a carabiner clip to simplify carrying
Allows for storing a charge with the solar panels or hand crank
cons: Takes several minutes with the hand crank or solar panels to receive any light

customer_reviews.title: Works well and seems pretty durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool product. So cool to not have to worry about batteries. We've had it for a few months but haven't had too much real use for it yet, but it constantly gets used by my two year old. He always wants me to wind it up for him so he can shine it on things. And, so far, it hasn't broken even with him playing with it several times a week, so it must be made pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: someguy

customer_reviews.title: this is the best 10 bucks you will ever spend
customer_reviews.text: this is the best 10 bucks you will ever spend, the light is not super bright but in an emergency who cares, I bought this because recently we were in my wifes car and needed one, I had 3 of flashlights in her car, glove box, console and emergency kit in the back . they all had dead batteries. I was really ticked off, if I had this I would not ever need to waste time on dead batteries, problem solved, If you think this is an 800 lumen light your an idiot, its for emergency use and not super bright but will get you out of a jamb or fix a tire at night etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jo deb Z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My little boy loves flashlights but always leaves them on and runs down the battery. I bought him this and he loves it! I don't have to replace the battery and it stands up to his abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrie

customer_reviews.title: Flashlight handles the weather
customer_reviews.text: Flashlight works as expected. It tolerates bad weather well. I found this out when I dropped it outside, where it was rained on, snowed on and frozen for four days until I found it because I noticed a dim light still on after four days. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good little flashlight but...
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight is just what I needed to make me feel better about my young son walking to bus stop in the wee morning hours or the winter season. This little sucker gets BRIGHT, and it runs for a pretty good stretch on a crank cycle. I like that it can attach to his backpack and it's small and lightweight. I gave it 4 stars because the little knob on the crank came off not too long after purchasing. It can be easily reattached with some gorilla glue but it got lost somewhere and so now it is more difficult to crank. If it weren't for that, this would have received a perfect review.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi H.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but it’s feature of the clip falls short
customer_reviews.text: Black part of the flashlight is rubber, which is great as it won’t scratch or crack if you accidentally drop it. The hand crank seems to be built well as we had several people crack it pretty hard. Only complaint is the opening of the clip. Doesn’t open that wide so can’t really put it through many basic products. Simple straps won’t be an issue but fences, free limbs or car parts would require you to be selective
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something I could put in my bug out bag that wouldn't take batteries and wouldn't let me down. This is small but it works fine! I love that I can crank it for 1 minute and I get light for 8 minutes. It also has a solar panel on the side, and I haven't tried that yet, it wouldn't even have to work perfectly and I would still be happy with it. I will order a couple more soon here to keep in the car and in my night stand drawer.
customer_reviews.author: bg1

customer_reviews.title: this unit may just have a bad battery. I'll try exchanging it and will update ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son. He loves it, but it can't hold a charge. Either from winding or from being left in the sun. It produces light while you're cranking, but as soon as you stop the lights go off. Based on other's reviews though, this unit may just have a bad battery. I'll try exchanging it and will update my review based on the replacement. update: Returned the defective one and they shipped out a new one. New one works great and my son LOVES it. Updated my ranking accordingly. Manf. was very responsive. No one makes 100% perfect products, but it's nice when it's broken to have it replaced so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: alcimedes

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: Totally below any standard. This is the worst flashlight maybe ever. I would not trust it to get me to the bathroom in the middle of the night. I will be sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Kolorado Ken

customer_reviews.title: Compact Little Light
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, this is a nice little flashlight. It's very compact, fairly sturdy, and reasonably bright. However, I found that cranking the unit for 1 minute produced enough energy for just 3 minutes of light, at which point the light dims noticeably. I bought it for use during an emergency, so in that regard I think it works just fine, but for regular use it would be a bit of a hassle. I didn't have any issue with the switch like another reviewer -- it has a good feel and stays in the on position just fine. I haven't tested the solar cell just yet.
customer_reviews.author: E. Yuasa

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Durable little flashlight!
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in the glove box of a Honda Pioneer UTV. It’s been stored there for close to a year and when I get it out periodically to see if it’s still operable all it takes is about a 30 second crank and I’ve got a bright flashlight to use. Does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: NOT Durable
customer_reviews.text: It was broken within hours of receipt. It was dropped from the height of a 4 year old child and the whole solar panel side broke apart. Huge let down. The concept was great, but this is not a long lasting product
customer_reviews.author: chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Clipped on the go bag
customer_reviews.text: I love that this light has two ways to charge and a clip to affix it to my go bag. My only complaint would be it could be brighter but honestly I knew what I was getting into in that department. This is a utility light to help me see things up close and light up my feet if I don't have anything else with me. Great price and decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good little flashlight to have around in case of emergency or just to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little flashlight to have around in case of emergency or just when you need a flashlight. It's nice that it can be either solar powered or by hand cranking. It has a good brightness that stays bright pretty long. I haven't run it down, but I have other hand crank flashlights that fade fairly quickly even if they stay on a while. The clip at the end of the handle is a plus although I haven't had to use it. The quality seems pretty good especially compared to other small, hand-crank flashlights.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K

customer_reviews.title: Good so far and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Puts out enough light to get around in the dark. Very small and light weight as well. Crank handle seems a bit flimsy so I will be careful about getting carried away with cranking. Works as well as and is just as bright and a lot lighter as an older Eveready crank light I have. This is not a torch light or tactical light. It's meant to find your way around in the dark and not be dependent on consumable batteries. I will update this report if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: The One

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely love how compact the item is, super bright and convenient to have attached to your backpack. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, Reliable Flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight really works well and is an excellent addition to any survival or camp kit. You're not going to get the super long throws of light that you would from some of the other high end flashlights, but that not what this is about. It's a utilitarian light for short range lighting (20' to 40') that doesn't require batteries and will work. I keep it as a back up, in case something happens.
customer_reviews.author: M. James

customer_reviews.title: Crank broke and battery stopped holding a charge.
customer_reviews.text: Like nearly all these cheap lights labelled as emergency use, it will fail you long before you need to rely on it. The crank mechanism can't handle more than a few uses at best. And the battery won't hold a charge after only very light use. Just more Chinese junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not bright at all
customer_reviews.text: It works at least. However, brightness is a big issue for me. Good thing is you have a light when you need it. Bad thing is you may need another light if you need to read or to see things at 30 feet in front.
customer_reviews.author: HAN KIM

customer_reviews.title: Fake product
customer_reviews.text: I thought that I bought a fake one. No meco logo? No the same one as my friend bought. ??? zero star!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Effiecient,Useful
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a good product. I use this flashlight almost every night. Keep in the windowsill of my bedroom; so handy...no stubbed toes in the middle of the night. Handy when electricity goes out, or our little dog needs to get up in the middle of the night and soft light doesn't wake spouse. Has stayed charged since I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Brix

customer_reviews.title: Solar is #1
customer_reviews.text: Dependable, and very affordable, works awesome, I leave it in my vehicle window so its always ready with a charge from the sun! Nice to be backed up by the hand crank, this way you will never go without a flashlight. Replaced my other hand crank light I had for fifteen years , thus one is smaller and with added solar is more Awesome! Like solar power read my unknown solar manual also available on amazon. Please leave me a review. Solar Independent Utility Systems Manual. Again fantastic product !, kyle
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W. Loshure

customer_reviews.title: Good light for such a compact size
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a great light to have. Quite compact compared to a lot of other hand-crank lights. Perfect to have in a convenient location for an emergency, or takes up no space in any kind of pack. It definitely doesn't perform as well as a battery-based flashlight but you never have to worry that this one can't generate some light.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dohoda

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son's back-pack adventures for the, "just in case", moments. You're not going to blind anyone, but it beats nothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for just about anyone. I think this is a wonderful item to keep in your car's glove compartment, in your nightstand, in your purse or backpack. The size is great. Not too big but able to put out big light and you don't have to worry about batteries! Love it. Have ordered it multiple times for gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Good Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for an emergency/72 hour kit. I wanted a wind-up flash light so I'd never have to worry about batteries. This works as you would expect. Is it the greatest flashlight I own? No. But it will get the job done and provide me with what I need? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: We need a much more Brightest.
customer_reviews.text: The most important aspect of any cordless powered lighting source supply's, readily available Battery. At any times, in an any condition's. What good is a dead light/or a flash light, in an emergency situation any ways? i love this Flashlight, dependability, reliability & a worry free, carry on your pockets @ any times. B- Suggestion: Why don't you make a better, Bigger with a much more Brightest, multi LED device. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Khan of 1/2 Jahaan

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: You have to continually keep winding so the light will stay on it kinda defeats the purpose would have been nice if once you would it up the light stays on just little bit of time not impressed with this product
customer_reviews.author: Swagga Digital

customer_reviews.title: Works good for emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright as I thought it would be but works good for the emergency situations I bought it for so you don’t have to worry about batteries if ever stuck on the side of the road at night with your car broken down, the last thing you want to do at that time is run down your phone battery using it as a light so this does work. Just wish it would have been made to shine a little bit brighter than it does
customer_reviews.author: Jaimee Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Nice light
customer_reviews.text: Solar panel works great , the winding power works good. Light is more than sufficient in brightness for what this lights purpose is. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Keith Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight ever!
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I would have a flashlight that didn't rely on a battery. This is solar powered and hand cranked. Holds a charge for a long time. I leave it in a sunny window when not using, so it is charged up when I need it. Great for travel, camping, hiking or walking a night. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Nice product that works as advertised. I charged it outside in the sun for 5 days before using it and it works fine, no complaints. (I charged it via solar cuz I was too lazy to crank the handle for the initial charge).
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Excelent light for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This little light is exactly what i was looking for! Its compact, has a clip to attach it to any number of items, and 2 different charging options. The hand crank is smooth as you crank it. It does produce a sound when cranking as you are charging, but its not too loud (just a whirring sound). Came with a small charge right out of the box, so you know it works right away. I will definitely be getting one or two more!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin W.

customer_reviews.title: Love this lil gadget! A must to have
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to have found this! It worked perfectly when we lost power! Just crank it for a few seconds and the light is bright! I leave it by the exit/entrance door with my car keys!
customer_reviews.author: anakonda

customer_reviews.title: Get one of these
customer_reviews.text: A very cool, clip on light. I hooked this to my hydration/back pack. It is bright and charges easily in moderate sun light. I love the hand crank for times you have little or no sun light. The clip works well and has held to my pack for a couple of weeks so far. This is a great gift or purchase for hiking, fisherman, survivalist or for your glove box. I highly recommend this for a natural or man made disaster prep bag,
customer_reviews.author: beatwalker

customer_reviews.title: Works if you don't want both hands free.
customer_reviews.text: Works when actively cranking by hand, but even after several hours in the sun and several minutes of cranking it will not turn on. It'll work for getting around if the lights go out and I don't need both hands free. Otherwise not very useful. Disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Leeta B.

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: The light is ok bright but has streaks, i believe it the bulb design, but it alright for in house use for temporary outage. That also why i got it. Just in case power goes out again.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed 🙏

customer_reviews.title: Really Very Pleased With this little light and I might buy 1-2 more.
customer_reviews.text: Love Everything About It including it being a bit small but foes a good job- I have seen crank up flashlights but never would buy one before because something in my mind kept saying these kinds are probably junk, This one definitely not junk it will go into the bug out bag and I might buy another one for the car and or house
customer_reviews.author: SECRET SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Not bright, does not charge well
customer_reviews.text: I needed a flashlight for when I'm watching over the dogs in the back yard. This product puts out a dim light. Things are visible (but not sharply so) up to about 3 feet. The brightness dims quickly further away than that. Need to frequently crank the handle to keep the light bright and on. I leave it on the windowsill all day for the solar charging, but when I use it come evening, I need to keep cranking it, because its light brightness dims quickly with use. The handle is thin, flexible, and fragile. Need to be very careful when cranking it. Item can for brief, emergency use only.
customer_reviews.author: anonymus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergency kit!
customer_reviews.text: This item was was bright right out of the box. I purchased it for my earthquake kit. It works by solar and crank. The price was perfect! I hope I never have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: June R

customer_reviews.title: Timed one. Light dimming but still on at 4 hours
customer_reviews.text: Bought seven for stocking stuffers. Not a lot of light but enough to find what you need. Actually tested one by placing in window ledge for several days. Then cut light on and used a clock trimmer. Although it was still on but started dimming, I cut the trimmer off at four hours. We are going to attach it to front car window ledge with Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: JBM

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a handy light to have around in this age of power outtages.
customer_reviews.text: The crank works to light the flashlight and it's fairly bright. Where we live, PG&E regularly turns off our power lately, so I bought this to have on hand because it's not dependent on having a battery.
customer_reviews.author: JeriMac

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller then I thought it'd be, but ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller then I thought it'd be, but that's 100% on me. Right out of the box, this thing winds straight up and casts a bright light even in the daytime. A built-in clip allows it to get clipped onto a belt, backpack, toolkit, whatever. The only gripe I have - and this is me searching for things to gripe about - is that it feels flimsy in the hands, and is a bit too small for my mutant grippers. For the price, though, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Collison

customer_reviews.title: Charges quickly
customer_reviews.text: Small hand sized flashlight. Has three lights inside that seem bright so far. Nice that it takes either solar charge or crank charge, so it can work at night even if it's not charged. I tried cranking it maybe 10-20 circles and it allowed it to have light with just that amount of cranking.
customer_reviews.author: M Howard

customer_reviews.title: Compact Unit
customer_reviews.text: This light is surprisingly compact for a unit with both hand crank and solar cell. I bought one for the dash pocket of each car. Just a few seconds of cranking will get the light on. A full minute of cranking will provide about 10 minutes of light.
customer_reviews.author: LarryFromHendersonville

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the kids camping
customer_reviews.text: Saves a ton on batteries, and you will always have a light just a few cranks away.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Nice little crank light. It's my first one, so it's difficult to rate battery life and durability. But It works and feels like a sturdy product. A pleasant surprise for a $9 purchase. I plan to buy several more.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly74

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but brittle plastic
customer_reviews.text: The clip on mine broke randomly during regular use. Love the crank and solar charging, keep on with my camping gear and my fly away kit. when the clip isn't broken.... it is nice to hang in the apex of the tent or on a bunk. plastic was brittle, but product was cheap and recharging should last a while so no big complaints
customer_reviews.author: Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Not to bright but never needs batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Not the brightest of flashlights but works and never needs batteries.
customer_reviews.author: eric ninja

customer_reviews.title: sooo practical tool
customer_reviews.text: The light on it is very bright. and it Charges fast. Good quality for value.
customer_reviews.author: William Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a couple of times at night and it's really bright for such a small light. After just a few cranks it was ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: i take it everywhere...especially when i travel
customer_reviews.text: I travel quite a bit for work, and you never know when there will be an issue and you need a flashlight. I love this one because I do not have to worry about batteries going dead, and the weight of carrying extra batteries. Got one for other family members, too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Evans

customer_reviews.title: GOOD so far
customer_reviews.text: Both the solar and crank power-up work as advertised. I have not had mine long enough to see if there are any problems with keeping it lit or battery problems. I did not look at the picture with the hand and so did not realize that it is rather small but it does put out a good light and stores well in the glove compartment of my car.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: you never know when you are going to need a light and you never know if you have batteries at hand. I really recommend having this around (in the car, home, backpack...)
customer_reviews.author: JOSE G

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Super great product since it can be charged in 2 ways...and batteries are totally not needed and no cords...the clip is heavy-duty, and it's really well made!! I got them for grandkids and found that they also are small enough to fit into my medium sized purses, so I got one for me too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Grannie

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.  But what do you expect for the price?
customer_reviews.text: Its an "OK" flashlight. I bought it for the cool factor of being able to crank it to charge. Something found out by accident is the solar cell does a good job of maintaining charge with ambient room light. I was surprised. A nice light to have around
customer_reviews.author: Randle T. Bain

customer_reviews.title: good for the  price
customer_reviews.text: i left them on all night and in the morning it still had power, of course not as bright like when fully charged. i wanted to to see how long it lasted and if the solar worked. everything seems to work well!
customer_reviews.author: D&K

customer_reviews.title: Solid light for a steal.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a solid little unit. I was concerned that it would be cheaply built, however it looks good. Light is decently bright and the crank feels sturdy not fragile. I am glad to have it on my packing gear. The only concern will be how resistant it is to moisture, it never seems to fail that I get wet while I hike or camp.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Batteries never die
customer_reviews.text: One for me, one for hubby. I keep in my car
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Light to have for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great! It's so small but puts out some power! The crank is a tad noisy but it serves it's purpose well and I love that it has a carabiner attached. It clips perfectly to the strap of my Bug Out Bag! Will be great in emergencies and I won't have to worry about running out of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: These crank, LED lights were for my Operation Christmas child shoeboxes. They are rather inexpensively made and most likely will not last forever but they are going to someone who doesn't have any other source of light and since they don't need batteries should be useful for the kid.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Convenient little light, bright for its size
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little light. I've played around with it a few times, but haven't had any catastrophes yet to really test it. It's brighter than I expected for its size. I might prefer this with a similar item, maybe a lantern, to be really prepared for the catastrophe. Better yet, let's have no catastrophes!
customer_reviews.author: K. J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son that loves gadgets, loves this flashlight. He winds it up constantly as a fidget. The battery lasts a few hours on a few minutes wind up.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle Hill

customer_reviews.title: Worth having!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, is bright enough and light weight. Noisy when cracking. Great for kids, no more buying batteries and no more taking my emergency flashlight to play!
customer_reviews.author: cristina Loarca

customer_reviews.title: Great for the glovebox
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. I have broken handles on similar flashlights in the past so I am careful, but this one seems strong and is working fine for the three months I have been using the flashlight. Nice to have a flashlight that does not run down batteries. Perfect size for the glovebox.
customer_reviews.author: TL Damron

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works and doesn't need battery replacements. Great addition to my tackle box and fishing vest, for those just in case kind of moments. I have a flashlight on my phone, but I don't always want to take my phone out and play with it when I'm standing over water. This is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: wjg

customer_reviews.title: Works well and seems durable enough
customer_reviews.text: Not much more to say than that it works, both the photovoltaic panel and the hand crank, and provides a bright light. I like the security of knowing I don't have to depend on batteries or the availability of electricity to power a flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Seems good but time will have to test
customer_reviews.text: Flashlight works right out of the box! I will update my review in 6 months to see if this really is solar/crank powered, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made but it is a low price product. Not that bright but works for in a pinch
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: potentially worse than a keychain light
customer_reviews.text: Light is very dim, potentially worse than a keychain light. Depth of the road maybe 5 to 10 feet at most and do not expect to light up when you're shining it.
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Good to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a in case bag.I used it very little, it seems like it would do the job. Nothing special about it. Comes pre charged and if the light start to get dim give it a couple cranks. I would say it's good to have one of these around.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little light, don’t let the size fool you! It’s very bright. I keep it on my water pack, during my hikes it’s much easier to make my way with this light guiding me.
customer_reviews.author: Karla G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It keeps working with NO batteries, I love it. It was on my desk when the power went out at work, I led a few people down 3 flights of stairs that would have been dark, but I had this light.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this little flashlight. I keep it in my truck so I have a light if needed. Knowing I can charge it by cranking makes me feel a bit of comfort. The solar power charging probably means I will rarely need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Shrewsbury

customer_reviews.title: Great little Light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who was constantly leaving his other flash lights on at bed time. This thing is great he loves to wind it up even when it is fully charged. Update About a year later this thing is still working!!! Bust Buy ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Naval

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made and is bright
customer_reviews.text: I really like this light so far. It doesn’t seem very bright during the day time but once the sun goes down or in a house at night I feel like it very bright especially for a crank flashlight. Now I keep it in my bag for emergencies!
customer_reviews.author: bamaquagirl

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and not overly bright
customer_reviews.text: Nice little light. Perfect for bedside, not too bright like most headlamps are.
customer_reviews.author: John Swift

customer_reviews.title: Best value!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these, giving them as gifts now. They work exactly as designed, I keep one in my vehicle and at home now. I have not put them to any extreme hard tests, but for normal everyday situations, they work good. Excellent value!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: way better than anticipated..
customer_reviews.text: way better build and size than expected not too big not to small...love the solar panel aspect power always available....carabiner extra super plus...
customer_reviews.author: migs

customer_reviews.title: I keep this in my glove compartment as an emergency ...
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my glove compartment as an emergency flash light. I ran out of gas in the middle of the night the other day and pulled it out. It was fairly dim but after cranking it for a few minutes it brightened up significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by how long the light lasted on this with not many cranks. I was thinking it was similar to other ones that I have purchased in the past and not work but boy was I wrong. This is an amazing hand crank flashlight and do recommend this for camping, hiking, walking at night or even to just have it in the house in case the power goes out. Least with this you don't have to worry about batteries. Would buy as gifts or even to have another one on a different level in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Nordwall

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Being in need of a flashlight is so frustrating. This flashlight can serve anywhere at any time. Works exactly as described. I was so impressed I bought three, one for me and my two sons.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Noble

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car or backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great little light for emergencies or when you just need some light. They are not super bright but for their size and usefulness they are worth the money. I keep them in the car and our backpacks since they do not require batteries they are always ready when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: The Guy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth getting for backpacking and it is very bright ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth getting for backpacking and it is very bright I was very impressed & surprise how bright it was for not being battery-operated and solar paneled !!! :)
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Brite
customer_reviews.text: great little dual charge light. charges fast and lasts many hours...we use it for nite time fishing..
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Light
customer_reviews.text: Great unit to have in an emergency as batteries to run out. The solar cell works great in charging of the light when you have time to place it in the sun. The crank give you the ability to charge the batteries at anytime. Have one in my bug out bag at all times.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pippin

customer_reviews.title: Great little emergency light
customer_reviews.text: This little light is great. I have quite a few flashlights etc but if your power goes out who knows how long it will be? With this I know I won't run out no matter how long it is. The only thing is I wish I had got one a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Chewthrutherestraints

customer_reviews.title: Easy to crank
customer_reviews.text: I live in FL so we get hurricane and this is perfect for when we lose power.
customer_reviews.author: Papo

customer_reviews.title: Emergency supplies!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for the bug out bag. Responsive and easy button yo do more code. I think I will order more for all the kids! Love the clip.
customer_reviews.author: nvwikiwiki

customer_reviews.title: Not the best light for outdoors during night
customer_reviews.text: This item is durable, small and eco friendly because of the solar charging but when I used it for a night track with my son during his camping trip, it did not provide the brightness that the other flashlights carried by leaders and cubs. My son said mom this is the cheapest light ever.
customer_reviews.author: MCCP

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have when a possible hurricane is coming. The hand crank is easy to use and creates a bright light from the flashlight. Glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Handy flashlight!
customer_reviews.text: Great little flashlight. I think I may get one for myself. It was a gift for a gift game. Recipient really liked it. It is solar and the crank sure does work to give you light. A good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dazzled

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little light. It's small, durable and dual functional with solar and winding power options. Not the brightness but will work in emergencys and will be reliable without the hassle of batteries! This one is going in my EDC bag. I will be ordering more for our earthquake / emergency home kit and our bug out bags. I wish it was made in the U.S. tho.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a long time. Some challenges after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent light but relies on an internal rechargeable battery
customer_reviews.text: It supplies a decent amount of light with just a few cranks. Biggest downside is that it relies on an internal rechargeable battery. Over time that battery will fail. I will keep it as a backup as long as it lasts but will get one that has a capacitor instead of a battery.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dek

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: This nifty little flashlight is a must have in emergencies and when power is out which it is where I live in NorCal a lot. Easy to crank. Not super bright but better than stumbling around in th dark. Very small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: LAW

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my pack
customer_reviews.text: Good quality item. I have been using it for a month now and like it. Holds its charge well and is bright. Solar charge works and so does the crank. I would highly recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Tinker Bell

customer_reviews.title: Well made but not super bright
customer_reviews.text: Good quality build. Works when you need it too. You get 5-8 mins a light from 1-2 mins of cranking. The solar cell will fully charge flash light in about 8 hours. Brightness is not overly strong, but is sufficient. Coupled with traditional flashlights you can make it though any power outage. .
customer_reviews.author: Gatlin69

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little rechargeable flash light !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for camping purposes. But it lights my way wonderfully when walking the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie M.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the night shift
customer_reviews.text: Compact, green, solar powered, and hand cranked if necessary. I'm really happy with the purchase. Allowing the flashlight to collect sunlight daily will eliminate the need to crank.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

product_meta.title: MECO Hand Cranking Solar Powered Rechargeable Flashlight Emergency LED Flashlight Carabiner Dynamo Quick Snap Clip Backpack Flashlight Torch Weather Ready, 8 Lumen
feature_bullets: Emergency flashlight with a built-In rechargeable battery, store energy in for a long time.
High conversion efficiency, cranking for 6 mins gives an hour light, Ready for the uncertain world.
Classic design, durable, outdoor survival gear, best gift for outdoor.
Size: 124x45x32mm, Weight: 86g. With a quick to use carabiner clip, Clip it on your backpack and take.
100% Brand new, guaranteed by MECO! We provide the best service，feel free to contact us at any time.
